1.text: Cut 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) off both ends of the pepper.

2.text: Slice down the side of the pepper to open it.

3.text: Lay the pepper flat to remove the seeds and ribs.

4.text: Remove the stem from the top of the pepper.

5.text: Divide the remaining pepper up into 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) strips or cubes.

6.text: Wear rubber gloves to protect yourself from the heat.

7.text: Remove the stem by slicing about 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) below it.

8.text: Slice the pepper in half vertically to open it.

9.text: Scoop the seeds and core out if you wish to reduce the heat.

10.text: Slice the pepper into 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) strips or cubes.

11.text: Put on a pair of rubber gloves if you’re working with a hot pepper.

12.text: Slice 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) off the top to remove the stem.

13.text: Run the knife along the flesh to remove the core.

14.text: Divide the pepper up into 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm)-thick rings.
